title: JSON API Schema
description: This is a schema for responses in the JSON API format. For more, see http://jsonapi.org

meta.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

data.description: Primary data **MUST** appear under a top-level key named "data". Primary data **MUST** be either a single resource object, an array of resource objects, or a value representing a resource relationship.

resource.description: "Resource objects" appear in a JSON API document to represent primary data and linked resources.

included.description: A list of resource objects that are related to the primary data and/or each other ("included resources").

topLevelLinks.description: URLs related to the primary data.

links.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

self.description: A `self` member, whose value is a URL for the relationship itself (a "relationship URL"). This URL allows the client to directly manipulate the relationship. For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.

relationshipToOne.description: References to other resource objects in a to-one ("relationship"). Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

relationshipToMany.description: References to other resource objects in a to-many ("relationship"). Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object. This could be an empty array for empty to-many relationships.

data.description: An array of objects each containing "type" and "id" members for to-many relationships.

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

href.description: A URI that **MAY** yield further details about this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

links.description: An array of JSON Pointers [RFC6901] to the associated resource(s) within the request document [e.g. ["/data"] for a primary data object].

paths.description: An array of JSON Pointers to the relevant attribute(s) within the associated resource(s) in the request document. Each path **MUST** be relative to the resource path(s) expressed in the error object's "links" member [e.g. ["/first-name", "/last-name"] to reference a couple attributes].
